name: SingleRecordView
title: Single Record View

properties.name: entityName
properties.description: Name of the entity for metadata lookup

properties.name: fields
properties.description: Fields to display in order. If not provided, shows all non-system fields

properties.name: labelWidth
properties.description: Width of label column in pixels (table layout)

properties.name: showEmptyFields
properties.description: Whether to show fields with no value

properties.name: maxTextLength
properties.description: Maximum characters for text fields before truncation

properties.name: allowOpenRecord
properties.description: Whether to show an Open Record button for the record

events.name: fieldClicked
events.description: Fired when a field value is clicked

parameters.name: eventData
parameters.type: { fieldName: string; value: any; fieldType?: string; record: Record<string, any> }
parameters.description: Object containing field name, value, optional field type, and the full record

events.name: openRecord
events.description: Cancelable event fired before opening a record. Set eventData.cancel = true to prevent default behavior

parameters.name: eventData
parameters.type: { record: Record<string, any>; entityName: string; cancel: boolean; primaryKeys: Array<{ FieldName: string; Value: any }> }
parameters.description: Cancelable event object. Set cancel to true to prevent the record from opening

exampleUsage:
<SingleRecordView
  record={selectedDeal}
  entityName="Deals"
  fields={['DealName', 'Stage', 'Amount', 'CloseDate', 'OwnerID']}
  layout="card"
  highlightFields={['Amount', 'Stage']}
  allowOpenRecord={true}
  onOpenRecord={(eventData) => {
    // Example: Cancel if deal is in certain stage
    if (selectedDeal.Stage === 'Lost') {
      eventData.cancel = true;
      alert('Cannot open lost deals');
    }
  }}
/>
